title: Rollins School of Public Health
author: Amy M Crisp; M Elizabeth Halloran; Ira M Longini; Gonzalo Vazquez-Prokopec; Natalie E Dean
cleaned_text: Professor Assistant Professor Faculty, Biostatistics and Bioinformatics Jointly Appointed, Epidemiology I am motivated by high-impact quantitative problems in global health. My research focus is on methods to evaluate the effectiveness of interventions targeting emerging infectious diseases, especially vaccines. This includes the use of flexible and model-informed trial frameworks tailored to the outbreak setting, as well as observational study designs such as the test negative design. Prior and ongoing work is in HIV, Ebola, Zika, chikungunya, dengue, and COVID-19. I am co-director of the [Emory Alliance for Vaccine Epidemiology (EAVE)](https://emoryeave.org/). Selected Honors and Awards: - 2022 - Leadership Academy, Committee of Presidents of Statistical Societies (COPSS) - 2020 - Provost's Excellence Award for Assistant Professors, University of Florida [Personal Website](http://nataliexdean.net) [Google Scholar Profile](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=H7nim_oAAAAJ&hl=en) [View Biostatistics -
